name: Courtyard by Marriott Milwaukee Downtown

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay. Lobby was nice. Room was good sized. Location downtown was convenint. My only comment is parking was $18 for valet when the garage a half a block away was $5 which is where I ended up parking.
reviews.title: Nice property, good location!

reviews.text: This hotel had great service, we were provided with a room 3 hours before check in time. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful,they answered all our questions even providing additional helpful information. The hotel was clean and is located very conveniently close to attractions and a variety of restaurants. We are already planning our return trip to next year's Mexican Fiesta and will be staying at this same hotel.
reviews.title: Fiesta Time

reviews.text: The only thing we did not like about our room was that the sink was located outside of the bathroom, which disturbed those that were still sleeping. Also, our room was kind of noisy because we were facing the main street and heard street noise and traffic.
reviews.title: Great location in downtown Milwaukee

reviews.text: Stayed over a weekend during a leisure visit to Milwaukee. Front desk acknowledged my Marriott platinum status and I received a room upgrade. Staff was friendly and quick with check in. The lobby here is the new Bistro concept. Very large lobby, clean and modern. They also had an interesting back room off the lobby that was decorated very modern and tranquil. Rooms were standard Courtyard issue, no surprises. We were in the room during housekeeping hours but they were able to come in later and clean our room, so nice service there. Hotel is walking distance to Lakefront, Water St., and 3rd Ward district. Nice location and it's connected to the Grand Ave. shops if you want to grab something quick at Walgreens or for a coffee. Would gladly stay again next trip to Milwaukee.
reviews.title: We didn't want to leave!

reviews.text: My son and I decided to take a mini-vacation north to Milwaukee and wanted to stay downtown to be able to take advantage of all that Milwaukee has to offer.
reviews.title: Good service, but rough night's sleep

reviews.text: The hotel was better than I expected. Clean rooms, updated lobby, free Internet access, complimentary coffee and good front desk staff (thank you Andie for giving us a corner room for our anniversary). I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay in the downtown area.
reviews.title: A very nice experience

reviews.text: We stayed at the Courtyard Downtown Milwaukee for two weekend nights in October. The hotel seems very recently updated, with a new lobby and very clean and modern rooms. We were able to get adjacent rooms with the people we were traveling with, which made it convenient for us traveling with our 19 month old son. The hotel is conveniently located downtown and within walking distance to nice restaurants and bars. It was also easty to get onto the freeway to travel to the mall and zoo. Parking was in a garage adjacent to the hotel and was $15/night for self park with easy in and out access. You can get breakfast in the hotel lobby (not complimentary), but it seemed pricey and had limited selection so we walked a couple blocks to the Hilton and ate breakfast there. My only minor complaint of this hotel was maid service didn't clean our room until after 4pm on Saturday. We had been at the zoo all morning and afternoon and were surpised to come back to a room that hadn't been attended to yet. Other than that minor detail, this hotel provided great accommodations and we would stay again on another visit to Milwaukee.
reviews.title: Modern, Clean, Convenient

reviews.text: I booked this hotel on expedia and got a great deal! Nice new lobby and beautiful pool/spa area. Attached to Grand street mall which, to be honest, seemed like a failed economic redevelopment project. Lots of empty stores and strange people wandering around. Had a decent food court if you could stand the other patrons. Hotel rooms were very clean but they could use some new furniture, some items worn looking. The bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great value.

reviews.text: The rooms at this property are not horrible, slightly outdated but nothing horrible. I would definitely recommend this hotel for people that are traveling for fun and not business. The were some issues:
reviews.title: Property not up to Marriott Standard

reviews.text: Although I am a Platinum rewards member, I was placed on the 2nd floor right next to the elevator. My preferences say a high-floor but I didn't want to be difficult and accepted the room. However, the main issue I had was the noise. For one, I could hear and feel (the wall vibrated) every single time the elevators were going up and down. This was consistent of course. Also, I heard the dings from the elevator each time it stopped on the 2nd floor. The other thing that bothered me was that my room faced dumpsters (from the connected mall) and I was woken up before my alarm went off from the garbage trucks collecting garbage. I understand it's a location issue, but still can be annoying. I suppose if you make sure to not stay next to the elevator and on a higher floor you will have better luck.
reviews.title: Hometeam Event Nightmare!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here while visiting Marquette University. Is within a couple of blocks of the university campus. Entrance is a little hidden and you have to look for it. Be aware there's a $15/day parking charge, or $20/day to valet park. (Don't have a "big" car, or you'll have trouble parking it.) TV channels are limited (but we weren't there to watch TV). WiFi worked sporadically. Staff was courteous and helpful during check in/out. Within walking distance (0.5 miles) to numerous restaurants, bars, etc. Overall, our stay was a pleasant one.
reviews.title: Good place to stay while visiting Marquette
Nice hotel!!!
reviews.text: This was a classic Courtyard: big, clean, and modern rooms, affordable cost, convientant location, friendly staff, and great food. The hotel was awesome, but The Bistro was even better!!! I will be back to this hotel soon 

Stayed here for two nights for business travel the week before Thanksgiving. If you are on business travel you will love the lobby. The whole hotel offers free wifi which is GREAT and welcomed now a days. You can sit at your own round booth with personal tv and plug in center, you can get Starbucks from the bistro all day and night, there are plenty of tasty healthy food choices and Milwaukee is very affordable! It's a smallish downtown with some great restaurants though. The service is also top notch, with happy, smiling employees who really seem to like their job. I spent a lot of time working in the lobby and eavesdropping - it's legit!
reviews.title: Great lobby, A+ service, but so so rooms

reviews.text: The rooms are so so. The beds are clean and comfy, but it's the overall carpet and bathroom wallpaper that need updating. I'm sure, in time. But it didn't change my overall impression of the stay. For downtown, it's a good choice,with affordable rates!
reviews.title: Classic Courtyard, Great Location

reviews.text: Great location if you need to be in downtown Milwaukee, within walking of several fun restaurants. Renovated, clean, everything you expect from a Courtyard. We had our friends meet us in the inviting lobby bar.
reviews.title: Courtyard Class and Comfort!

reviews.text: We were not disappointed. Great location, friendly and helpful staff, no problems whatsoever. Looks like it had been remodeled since our last stay here about 3 years ago. Very clean, no issues at all. We had booked at a higher price, a few weeks before. Apparently, the price came down, and they gave us the lower price.
reviews.title: Totally satisfied by this hotel!

reviews.text: If you are going to Milwaukee,the Marriott Courtyard is the ideal place to stay in the downtown area. Besides the ideal location, it is clean, comfortable and the staff could not be more accommodating. Everything was as we requested(extra pillows,high floor away from elevator, early checkin). it all made our annual visit something we look forward to every year. Add in the fact that in our haste I left my sons portable GPS unit in our room and did not realize it until the next day after we had checked out, I considered it gone but made a call anyway more than 24 hours after we had checked out. The person took my information and told me they would let me know if they located it. Well, I did not have my hopes up. In fact, 2 days later I was on my way to purchase a replacement when I received a call from the hotel telling me they found it and were shipping it back to me immediately. We will always stay at this hotel when visiting Milwaukee.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Staff

reviews.text: Found this hotel better than most reviews....I loved the location (one block from the riverwalk) and thought that the staff was nice and the room was good (except the AC, which was a little noisy). Parking is expensive, but I expected it in this location. Nice bar, and helpful front desk people (gave lots of advice and hooked us upwith SummerFest tickets). Would stay again.
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel in a great location

reviews.text: The week-long rate I paid was $119, good value for the hotel quality and location. My room was spacious, clean and comfortable, with a coffee maker and large HD TV. Comfortable bed. All the staff I dealt with were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly staff, good for the price

reviews.text: Drawbacks: the in-room aircon is very loud, soundproofing just adequate, and as someone else mentioned the shower temperature was variable. But this is a well-run hotel and I would stay here again as long as it costs less than the nearby Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Bad rooms, Bad staff - not up to Courtyard by Marriott standards

reviews.text: Was in Milwaukee for a teacher's conference at Marquette in May and wanted a hotel close to campus. While there were other hotels that were closer. I couldn't have chosen a better one. The check-in, room, amenities were wonderful. The hotel is downtown and close to everything and only about 6 blocks from the University. While I didn't spend a lot of time in the room, I could find nothing wrong. The bathroom was spotless and I appreciated the in-room coffee maker as I sleep until the last minute and didn't have time for breakfast downstairs. I love the city and will be back and the only place I will stay will be this Marriott.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check-in was very quick and the desk clerk was very pleasant upon arrival. The room was beautiful. It's in a very convenient location to so many activities in downtown Milwaukee during the summer, especially the summer festivals. I live in a suburb of Milwaukee but can't wait until an activity takes us back downtown so we can stay there again.
reviews.title: What a great hotel!

reviews.text: This is one of the Courtyards which has been updated with their new lobby. It included a great breakfast, made and served by hotel staff, a wine bar and a quiet room off the lobby complete with a fountain. Very relaxing. Rooms were very nice and very quiet. There were two huge wedding parties in the hotel when we were there and we did not hear a thing. Walking distance to Riverwalk and everything you want to do downtown.
reviews.title: Great location, great breakfast!

reviews.text: Was not up to marriot standards. Loud, rude staff, and overall not up to standard. Much better hotels in the surrounding area
reviews.title: Low for marriot standards

reviews.text: Newly renovated lobby is great! Plenty of TVs where you can change the channel to what you would like to watch, computers with free internet, a small cafe, and a new touch screen that has news, and a map of the city that gives you restaurant ideas. We loved the rooms and would probably stay again. Free shuttle to and from the casino and very friendly staff!
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.text: nice place, free breakfast, close to all the things needed in downtown milwaukee! we went to a concert and it was just around the corner. within walking distance to anything you need. fun time - nice hotel!
reviews.title: weekend with friends

reviews.text: We found this to be a good location in Milwaukee. The hotel was comfortable. We did feel that the insulation could have been better since we could hear the neighbors and people in the hallway at night.
reviews.title: Nice central location

reviews.text: All the ammenities travelers expect from the Courtyard brand... Close to downtown business district and lots of restaurants in walking distance. The rooms are a little outdated and laid out funny but comfortable and clean. The lobby is updated and modern. No sit down restaurant in the hotel but they do have a quick service cafeteria for breakfast. I would stay here again the next I am in town for business.
reviews.title: Good hotel in downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This location is fabulous. We took a weekend trip to Milwaukee, and enjoyed our stay here very much.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This location, must just have been renovated recently. The lobby is gorgeous. It has this cool touch screen in the lobby, when were you can look for locations and print directions... I was impressed.
reviews.title: Great location and nice hotel

reviews.text: A very nice hotel in downtown at the backside of a shopping mall. Everything was in walking distance, the room were spacious and clean, nothing to complain about.
reviews.title: Very nice, great location with everything in (European) walking distance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Valet Parking and Self Parking can be expansive but there is a surface next to the Self Parking Lot allow you overnight parking for 7 bucks, 1 Minute walking from the hotel.
reviews.title: Good accomadations in a convenient location.

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, you find everything you need.
reviews.title: GOOD EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: Stayed during Germanfest weekend so rooms in town were in short supply. Clean rooms, friendly staff and everything working made the stay a pleasant one. Our AARP price was $181 per night including parking and tax which is on the high side of our budget considering that no breakfast is included. However, the location makes this a good option and we will probably return in the future.
reviews.title: Fine for business travel

reviews.text: Just came back from a 2 night stay at this hotel, and I don't have one negative thing to say about it. Our room was quite sufficient with a good working TV. We requested a refrigerator and it was brought in promptly. Of course, I had to check for bed bugs and didn't see any evidence of any. The staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby had just been remodeled and the breakfast menu had changed. They used to have a nice (though pricy) breakfast buffet, and I missed that....but...they do have a variety of other items to chose from This hotel is attached to a mall, and I like that. They had free internet in the lobby and they have a basic work-out room. Based on my experience, I would recommend it. I find it expensive for my budget, but it IS downtown and probably pretty much in line with other hotels. .
reviews.title: a great find!

reviews.text: If one is seeking the Marriott Courtyard experience, it can be found here. This is a typical Courtyard hotel. That is not a negative comment, rather reflective of the fact that this property meets all the standards and appears just as every other Courtyard. The rooms were clean, bed comfortable, shower hot, TV was huge. The small 'bistro' area in the lobby offered breakfast and lunch items. The hotel was attached to a mall but we did not venture into the facility. All said, a fine accomodation for the downtown area.
reviews.title: Courtyard

reviews.text: Right in the middle of downtown and within walking distance to all you need. The staff always makes you feel welcomed and will go out of there way to assist you. The hotel is clean, rooms are spacious and a great value for the dollar. Whenever I am in Milwaukee, I will only stay at the Courtyard.
reviews.title: Sportsguy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Still a great place to stay in Milwaukee. Very accommodating. Nice big clean rooms. i think most king bedrooms have a pull-out sofa while the 2 bed queen rooms do not. Great beds with lots of pillows. They now offer food in the morning for breakfast and starting at 5 for dinner at a cost and there is a bar open until 2 AM.
reviews.title: Never disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed at many Courtyards though the years, this one is similar to all the rest. Nice, clean, good value. My only complaint, i am an early riser. I like to get up, get some coffee and surf the net while my wife sleeps in. This Courtyard has no coffee service until 7am! I was told they quit having 24 hour coffee when they remodeled. Clearly some "Bean counter" again wins out over real customer service. When is corporate America going to quit listening to these clowns?
reviews.title: Nice hotel, value. Why no early coffee?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to see a concert at the Riverside Theater in downtown Milwaukee. We stayed at this hotel and it was very nice. Clean, the parking was $15 a night, they had a cute bistro with Starbux, breakfast sandwiches, etc. The hotel was close to everything and the beds were comfortable. I recommend!
reviews.title: Very clean, comfortable beds, great location, reasonable parking

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Milwaukee Downtown Hotel Milwaukee
